eLCS_Offline_Environment module¶

Name: eLCS_Offline_Environment.py Authors: Ryan Urbanowicz - Written at Dartmouth College, Hanover, NH, USA Contact: ryan.j.urbanowicz@darmouth.edu Created: November 1, 2013 Description: In the context of data mining and classification tasks, the environment is a data set with a limited number of instances with X attributes

and some endpoint (typically a discrete phenotype or class) of interest. This module loads the data set, automatically detects features of the data.

algorithm published by Stewart Wilson (1995).

class eLCS_Offline_Environment.Offline_Environment[source]¶

Bases: object

getTestInstance()[source]¶

Returns the current training instance.

getTrainInstance()[source]¶

Returns the current training instance.

newInstance(isTraining)[source]¶

Shifts the environment to the next instance in the data.

resetDataRef(isTraining)[source]¶

Resets the environment back to the first instance in the current data set.

startEvaluationMode()[source]¶

Turns on evaluation mode. Saves the instance we left off in the training data.

stopEvaluationMode()[source]¶

Turns off evaluation mode. Re-establishes place in dataset.
